subject: AI & Agents
title: The First AI Winter
description: A quick win: understand The First AI Winter.

hook.text: By 1974, AI had promised the moon and delivered a flashlight. Funders pulled the plug.

buildup.text: The Lighthill Report in the UK declared AI research had failed to deliver on its promises.

discovery.text: Government funding dried up. Labs closed. Researchers scattered to other fields.

twist.text: The technology wasn't wrong â€” the timeline predictions were. Decades too optimistic.

climax.text: The survivors kept working quietly, planting seeds that would bloom 20 years later.

quiz.question: What triggered the first AI winter?
options: AI failed to deliver on overly optimistic promises
A computer virus destroyed AI research
AI became too dangerous to continue
